elements.subject: Add watchers in bulk edit mode

description.raw:
As a  
user/manager

I like to  
modify the list of watchers when doing bulk edits of work packages.

self.title: Add watchers in bulk edit mode

description.raw:
**As an** OpenProjectc.com user  
**I want to** be forced to reauthenticate  
**so that** someone taking over my session can not make those changes and I think twice before making those changes.

**Acceptance criteria**

  - There is a “danger zone” (like in GitHub) for critical commands where the user has to provide his password again such as:
      - Changing email address
      - Changing password
      - Deleting organization
      - Deleting repository
      - \[…\]

**Note**  
This is split off from \#16546
description.html:
As an OpenProjectc.com user
I want to be forced to reauthenticate
so that someone taking over my session can not make those changes and I think twice before making those changes.

Acceptance criteria

  • There is a “danger zone” (like in GitHub) for critical commands where the user has to provide his password again such as:
    • Changing email address
    • Changing password
    • Deleting organization
    • Deleting repository
    • […]

Note
This is split off from #16546

description.raw:
**As** an OpenProject  
**I want to** have a custom field API endpoint  
**so that** I can easily CRUD custom fields or their values (for list custom fields) via API.

**Acceptance criteria**

*   Custom field API endpoint (administration)

elements.subject: Add maximum number of events in activity page

description.raw:
**Current situation**

  - Loading of the page gets very slow if a lot of things happened the last couple of days.

**Expected behavior**

  - There should be a pagination that limits the maximum number of activity items shown on one page.
  - Place menu item “Activities” inside the “Modules” menu (split off of \#20512)
  - Uses aggregated journals (\#\#20690)

**Open**

  - What is a good number of maximum items for one page?

**Out of scope**

  - Styling
  - Configuration
description.html:
